answers.author: Maxwell Moline
answers.text:
Hello Jared, 
I posed your question to a contact who works in emergency management. Here's what she sent me:
The one at GW is really good--I know several people who did it and liked it. I'm not totally sure, but there are programs that are like graduate degrees, and some that are shorter training programs. If you're interested in a graduate degree, GW and UMD are among the few programs. Otherwise, you can look into courses at the Emergency Management Institute (http://www.training.fema.gov/EMI/). There may be more info about other programs on that website.
For more information about Emergency Management, you can also check out the topic page here on the Knowledge Network:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/topics/kn/Topic/79/Emergency_Management
I hope this helps to answer your question. Please let us know if we can be of any more help.
Max Moline
Knowledge Network Intern
ICMA

answers.author: Andrew Marquardt
answers.text:
North Dakota State University in Fargo, ND offers both a Master's and A Doctorate in Emergency Management.  I agree, EMI is a great resource for other courses that are offered free of charge for the most part, and you can take courses online to receive your Professional Development Series certificate from them.
